MakeTronica
Hivebot
 

Welcome to MakeTronica

a site dedicated to making things, preferably incorporating moving electrons.

 
 
Apr 12, 2016

Beehive Automatic Water Supply

I recently made an automatically refilling water supply for our two beehives.

Apr 3, 2016

Electronic Beehive Scale

In this post I’ll show you how I made scales to take regular electronic measurements of the weights of our soon-to-be-occupied beehives using a load cell and an Arduino.

Mar 20, 2016

Beehive Temperature and Humidity Sensors

Today I installed another temperature and humidty sensor in the broodbox of our beehives.

Mar 19, 2016

Solar Powered Beehives

Today I ran solar power to our two beehives to run the Raspberry Pi’s, Arduinos, and environmental sensors.

Mar 12, 2016

Hivebot Brain - Adding first sensors to a beehive

I’ve been working up to this for a while, and it’s finally coming together, and not a moment too soon. The bees will be arriving in a little over a month and I’ve still got a lot of work to do.

Dec 12, 2015

3D Printing an RFID Antenna Coil Bobbin

After figuring out how to create a custom wound RFID antenna for the ID-3LA RFID reader connected to an Arduino, I gave a shot at designing a 3D printable bobbin to wind the antenna onto. I was hoping for more range than I got, but otherwise, it worked.

Dec 10, 2015

Increasing Arduino Digital Outputs

Increasing the number of digital outputs on an Arduino, on a massive scale, is a lot easier than you might think. In these two videos I go through to process of wiring up the chip and writing code to activate the new outputs, and then I daisy chain 5 shift registers together to individually control 40 different digital outputs.

Dec 1, 2015

Holiday Lightshow - Glorious Dawn

This is our holiday lightshow for 2015. I worked on this off and on for the better part of the year, and managed to get to all working just in time for Thanksgiving.

Nov 16, 2015

Calibrating an RFID antenna.

If you have access to an oscilloscope, calibrating an RFID antenna is pretty easy. To find out how to make an RFID antenna first, see my previous post on the subject.

Nov 10, 2015

Making an RFID antenna for the ID-3LA reader

Making an antenna for the ID-3LA RFID chip is surprisingly easy. Here I demonstrate how I did it. I hope it helps with your RFID project.
